name: Chico Hamilton
description: '''Foreststorn''' "'''Chico'''" '''Hamilton''' (September 20, 1921 â€“ November 25, 2013) was an American jazz drummer and [[bandleader]]. He came to prominence as sideman for [[Lester Young]], [[Gerry Mulligan]], [[Count Basie]], and [[Lena Horne]]. Hamilton became a bandleader, first with a quintet featuring the cello as a lead instrument, an unusual choice for a jazz band in the 1950s, and subsequently leading bands that performed [[cool jazz]], [[post bop]], and [[jazz fusion]].
